strIntroduction: In this bus tour you will have a chance to look at beautiful moss phlox flowers with Mt Fuji in the background. The field filled with moss phlox flowers looks like a beautiful pink carpet covering it all. In this season, Mt Fuji is lightly powdered with snow and the combination with the flowers produce a sublime view. The Umaimono Festa festival, which coincides with the unique viewing opportunity is the perfect chance to taste the delicious local dishes from Yamanashi prefecture. There are fried noodles, wheat noodles, pork miso soup called Tonjiru, and sweets such as Taiyaki (pancake filled with bean jam) and ice cream with Shingen-Mochi (local rice cake with toasted soybean flour). At lunch you will stop at Fuji View Hotel to enjoy the buffet. This hotel is famous for their spectacular views of Mt. Fuji and you'll be able to try Yamanashi's specialty Hoto, noodles cooked with seasonal mushrooms, chicken, pork, fried tofu, pumpkin and curry, as well as other dishes that will definitely satisfy your appetite. This tour also includes cherry picking, you can eat as much as you want! Itinerary: Meet at Shinjuku station's west exit at 7:30 am. Visit the fifth station of Mt. Fuji. Buffet at "Fuji View Hotel". Viewing of moss phlox flowers and Mt Fuji. Cherry picking. Return to Shinjuku at 19:30 pm. Please note that on May 5th, 6th and 7th, the meeting time at Shinjuku is at 7:00 in the morning and that the tour does not visit the fifth station of Mt. Fuji.
strTitle: Enjoy Shibazakura and cherry picking in Yamanashi

strIntroduction: Takagiya is a famous shop for traditional Japanese confectioneries in Tokyo. The style in Takagiya has remained the same for more than 100 years since its founding in Katsushika ward's Shibamata area in the early Meiji era (1868-1912). You can taste the famous "Kusa Dango", mugwort dumpling, and other Japanese sweets that are popular to many visitors that come to the Shibamata Emperor Temple (Taishakuten). You can experience Japanese culture that has been inherited from the ancient times. Takagiya is a very famous spot that was used for filming the popular Japanese movie, "Otoko wa Tsurai yo" meaning "It's tough being a man". You will make 2 kinds of Japanese confectionery: "Nerikiri" is a "Wagashi" (Japanese sweets) made from white bean paste. This sweets is made with four seasonings and flour. In this experience, you can make it with seasoned flour. "Dango" has the same characteristics as dumplings. It is made using raw fresh powder which cannot be compared to others. In this experience, you will make them using skewers. Total 60 mins: Making "Wagashi" (40 mins) & Tasting (20 mins）
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese confectionery making in Shibamata area, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Enjoy a walking tour Pontocho, one of Kyoto’s most charming and historical areas. Travel back in time to enjoy the sights, sounds and tastes in this rustic area of Kyoto. With the streets lined with geiko houses and machiyas (teahouses), this street is one of Kyoto’s geisha districts where you might have a chance of catching a glimpse of them scampering between appointments in their zori sandals and gorgeous kimonos. After this, you will head to a local Shabu Shabu restaurant where you will enjoy a scrumptious array of vegetables, appetizers and beef. Your guide will explain to you everything you need to know about Kyoto food and culture while you eat until you cannot eat anymore! The second stop of the tour is a standing bar izakaya where you will enjoy a drink and appetizer as you immerse yourself with the locals of Kyoto. Finish of the tour with a dessert from a family owned stored that’s been making these sweet delights for the last 30 years. Learn everything about Kyoto food. Have fun beyond the temples and other Kyoto cultural things and ask your guide about the history and cultural surrounding the food of Kyoto!
strTitle: Kyoto Pontocho Walking Food Tour with Shabu Shabu Dinner

strIntroduction: Do you expect Tokyo to be a developed and modernized city? Yes, if you come to central Tokyo, you will find so many skyscrapers lined up on the streets, every shop has automatic doors, and vending machines are seen at many places. But I guess you will get bored with such landscapes soon on the next day, because it is so monotonous, and if you visit some other big city in the world, you can find such level of modernization everywhere. However, there are some areas in central Tokyo where old good mood still remains. The people there still preserve their Japanese original lifestyle, such as living in Japanese-style tatami rooms, going to a public bath every evening to soak in the large bathtub, visiting local shrines to pray for their wishes. The area around Toden Street Car is one of them. In the past there were many Street Car lines in Tokyo. Although most of them were closed because of modernization, only this line is still under operation retaining its good old atmosphere. On this tour, we will visit several attractions by the Street Car using 1-day free ticket. Compared to tourist places such as Asakusa, you can find more local atmosphere with fewer tourists. So let's explore retro Tokyo! First, we will start from JR Otsuka Station and move to the final stop, Waseda, by taking Toden Street Car. Viewing skyscrapers faraway, the train goes through the residential area at a slow pace. Then, from the final stop, we walk a little while until "Some-monogatari Museum". This museum was a dyeing studio in the past. Since the Edo era, about 400 years ago, they have been dyeing cloths at this place using water of Kanda-gawa River just in front. And now it is open as a museum that lets everybody experience traditional dyeing techniques. You can try it as well. After the museum, we go to Shin-Edogawa Koen Park, a Japanese garden. This park was a samurai residence about 150 yeas ago. Here you can see a traditional Japanese style building and a garden which is free for everybody to look around. After visiting Shin-Edogawa Koen Park, we will have lunch at the nearby Waseda stop. Then, after lunch, we will ride on Toden Street Car again until Kishimojin stop. This stop is close to Kishimojin-do which enshrines Kishimojin goddess. Kishimojin is the Indian goddess of delivering and nurturing children and has been worshiped by many people for about 500 years. Going through nice stone pavements with Zelkova elm trees on the roadside, we will reach the old large shrine which has a good retro atmosphere. Then, lastly, we will ride on Toden Street Car again to go to a public bath called "Sento". As you can see in the world hit movie "Thermae Romae" or "Spirited Away", Japanese people have a traditional custom to take bath every evening. We will go to a typical public bath not only for sightseeing but also for bathing! When you soak in hot water in a large bathtub, you will feel completely refreshed! Yes, you can have a really nice and enjoyable time! Come on and have fun with me, and a Little Monkey!! The time schedule is below: 10:00 Otsuka Station || (Street Car) 10:30 Waseda Stop | 10:40 Some-monogatari Museum | (Dyeing) 12:00 | 12:10 Shin-Edogawa Koen Park | (Seeing) | 12:50 Waseda Stop | (Lunch) 13:50 || (Street Car) 14:00 Kishimojin Stop | 14:05 Kishimojin-do | (Seeing) | 14:30 Kinshimojin Stop || (Street Car) 15:00 Oji Stop | (Monorail & Walking) | 15:30 Ebisu-yu Bath | (Taking Bath) | 16:30 Asuka-yama Stop || (Street Car) 17:00 Otsuka Station Alternatively, you can book a shorter, half-day version of the Street Car tour that starts in the afternoon. strIntroduction: This is a personalized food tour about Japanese traditional fermented farm food. There are some flexibility in schedule to meet your request. Below is the basic schedule of the tour: 10 am: meet the guide at Nagano Station Take the local train for 10 minutes and walk to the grandma's home Be welcomed by Sumie's big smile and tea See her fermented food collection and samples Learn how to make Asazuke (easy pickling) Enjoy homemade lunch full of fermented food made with homegrown veggies (Pickled cherry blossoms, Miso, Pickled Ume plums, Rice bran pickles and more) If time allows, we'll visit her vegetable garden by the river 2 pm: take the local train back to Nagano Station 3-4:30 pm: Please choose one of the options: Option 1: Visit a local artisan of Miso & Soy sauce maker, taste samples, shop and enjoy a fun variety of products Option 2: Visit a 400-year old sake brewery and Tsukemono pickled veggies store and enjoy sampling varieties of products and shopping. I am happy to help you choose quality food and ship it to your home. 5:30 pm: back to Nagano Station Included: lunch Not included: Fare for local train
strTitle: Learn about fermented farm food and miso in Nagano

strIntroduction: Have you ever dreamed of becoming a pilot? We offer this unique opportunity to have your childhood dream come to life at JFlight! JFlight in Yokohama, Kanagawa, is a unique place where you can experience flight simulation. You can enjoy piloting your own flight in the high-quality reproduced cockpit of AirBus A320. Usually only staff members and pilots are allowed to enter here, so it's a rare chance to see what being a pilot would really be like. Upon entrance into JFlight, you will see a variety of plastic airplane models decorating your surroundings. You will then listen to instructions regarding the cockpit and how to handle your own flight. Inside the cockpit, you can feel the atmosphere of a real flight! Once you sit in the pilot seat, you will definitely feel the excitement as a huge screen in front of you shows a real, natural landscape. Experience takeoff and landing from popular airports such as Narita Airport and Haneda Airport. This is a place not only for children, but adults, too! You can have fun with your family and friends. Take some unforgettable pictures in the cockpit of your day as a pilot! JFlight Operating Hours: Every day 10:00 - 22:00 *You can make reservations for every 30-minute time block (e.g. 10:00, 10:30, 11:00 etc...) You can choose between 3 different plans, outlined below! 1. Basic flight (30 minutes) Capacity: 1 person Experience: 1 Flight 2. Advanced flight (60 minutes) Capacity: 2 people Experience: 2 Basic Flights (taking turns), takeoff and landing 3. Kid’s flight (30 minutes) Ages: 7 – 12 Years old Capacity: 1 Person Experience: 15 minutes instruction, 15 minutes takeoff and landing
strTitle: Be a Pilot for a Day and Enjoy Flight Simulation in Yokohama

strIntroduction: This tour offers you round-trip bullet train Shinkansen tickets departing from Tokyo to Osaka and one night accommodation at Osaka's hotel. We recommend you to depart from Tokyo by bullet train Shinkansen to Osaka in the morning, so you will have more time to spend in Osaka to visit and explore Osaka's famous sightseeing spots. We also recommend you to visit Namba and Dotonbori at night, where you can find many Osaka's local food and shops. For the second day, we suggest you to take the bullet train Shinkansen in the afternoon so you will have more time to spend in Osaka. Some of Osaka Hotels available to book are as follows: - Osaka Garden Palace - Hotel NCB - Hotel Plaza Osaka - Hotel Hokkei Club Osaka - Shin-Osaka Esaka Tokyu Rei Hotel - Etc We will inform you which hotel is available after you make your reservation. Some famous sightseeing spots for Osaka are as follows: - Osaka Castle Osaka Castle is a more recent replication of the original castle built in the 1580s. It exhibits Osaka's pas with impressive stone walls, elegant gold-leaf trim and copper roofing. An observatory is perched atop the eight-story keep, making it a great place for panoramic views of the surrounding area. - Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan Featuring the largest aquarium tank in the world, Osaka Aquarium displays a breathtaking view of aquatic life. Favorites among the 15 natural habitats and 35,000 specimens are the Japanese Forest, whale shark, Arctic penguins and giant spider crab. -Shitennoji Temple The Shitennoji Temple site is the oldest in Japan, with the original temple being constructed in 593. Surrounding the temple are lush grounds including a serene Japanese landscape garden replete with manicured shrubbery, streams and waterfalls. - Umeda Sky Building Enjoy panoramic views of Osaka from the 39th floor of this innovative observatory in one of the city's most modern architectural structures. Make a reservation for this tour and enjoy exploring the history and the culture of Osaka!
strTitle: Round-trip bullet train ticket and one night stay in Osaka!

strIntroduction: On this tour you will visit 9 shops, each representing the different regions of Japan. Your experience will include samplings of Dashi (Japanese soup stock), Tamagoyaki, (egg roll), Konbu (kelp), tsukemono from Kyoto (pickled vegetables), Anago (salt water eel), Kamaboko (fish cake) Katsuoboshi (fish flakes), satsumaimo (sweet fried potatoes) and Wagashi (Japanese dessert). At the end of the tour we will finish with a complete Washoku (Japanese seasonal cuisine) at which time you will be able to discuss about the food you were introduced to on the tour and any questions you may have. Choose between these lunch menus you'd like to have: 1. Grilled Fish 2. Chicken Sukiyaki 3. Sushi-Soba-Tempura After lunch, we will guide you through Depachika (an underground smorgasbord of delicious food and delectable treats) where the tour will end. After we are finished you will be able to go straight into the subway or continue on your adventure at your own pace. If you want a crash course in the cuisine of Japan this is the tour for you!
strTitle: Embark on a "Flavors of Japan" Food Tour in Nihonbashi,Tokyo

strIntroduction: The shinkansen rail network in Japan is famous around the world for its punctuality, comfort, efficiency, safety and speed. With top speeds around 320 km/h, Japan Rail's bullet train, or shinkansen, is an experience in its own right, as well as a great way to travel. This program is a reservation for shinkansen bullet train ticket in between Osaka/Kyoto with a half day or one day private tour guide. The tour guide will arrange the trip schedule, so you can request the guide to include the places that you would like to visit. Some famous sightseeing spots for Kyoto are as follows: - Nakasu Nights Nakasu is a strip of land surrounded by two rivers in downtown Fukuoka. The area has been a red light district since the Edo-era. It's best known for its yatai stalls along the Naka River. The area is a sea of neon lights. - Fukuoka Castle Ruins Fukuoka Castle was once amongst the largest castles in Japan with 47 turrets and a large moat system. Today the area is a pleasant park that has several original buildings, gates and walls of the old castle. Parts of the moat are also preserved. - Hakata Ramen When Japanese tourists visit Fukuoka the first thing they do is head for a ramen stand to sample some fine Hakata Ramen. It's a dish with straight, thin noodles and an incredibly creamy pork bone broth. It's a b-gourmet food that stirs local passions. - Ohori Park A park modeled after the sublime West Lake in China. It's designed as a large scale water garden around a pond that was once a castle moat. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ※ Important Ticket Delivery & Pickup Information - Please Read Carefully ※ 1. Ticket Delivery We will deliver your tickets to your hotel in advance for your concierge to hold for you. The tickets will be available upon check-in. If you would like us to deliver the tickets to your hotel, please provide us with the following information: - Hotel name - The full name used for your reservation - Check-in date Please note: - We require at least 3 full business days for delivery. If placing a last minute booking within 3 days of your visit, or if you do not provide us your hotel information at least 3 full business days prior your ticket date, you'll need to collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. - If your hotel reservation details change, please tell us immediately through the Voyagin dashboard. - We only deliver to hotels with a concierge with whom we can confirm the receipt of the ticket delivery. We do not deliver tickets to hostels, guesthouses, or private residences. Please let us know if you are not staying at a hotel so we can provide our office details for you to pickup the tickets. 2. Ticket Pickup: If you are not staying at a hotel, book within 3 days of the ticket date, or prefer to pickup your tickets, you can collect your tickets from our Tokyo office in Shibuya. Our office is located 6 minutes (on foot) from Shibuya station. Address: (English) Miyamasu ON Building 5th floor, 1-15-8 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo (Japanese) 〒150-0002 東京都渋谷区渋谷 1-15-8 宮益 ON ビル 5F Detailed Directions (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/shibuya-station-to-voyagin-office Google Map (Shibuya station to Voyagin): http://voyag.in/voyagin-google-map

strIntroduction: Enjoy an exclusive private journey in Gifu with this private mini bus tour program with your friends or family only! Explore the breathtaking view of Shirakawago and the great nature of Hida Takayama with this tour! Enjoy a luxurious traveling experience with private driver and language assistance provided by our top-notch English or Chinese translator! This journey starts at Shirakawago, an area declared as UNESCO World Heritage site in 1995, which is famous for their traditional thatched roofs farmhouses. The farmhouses, which are more than 250 years old, look very beautiful during the winter, as the snow covers the thatched roofs, which are also utilized as a large attic space to cultivate silkworms. In addition to Shirakawago, you will also be visiting Hida Takayama, a city located in the mountainous Hida region of Gifu Prefecture. The city of Hida Takayama is rich in traditional atmosphere, especially in its preserved old town. The itinerary for the tour is as follows: - Departs from Nagoya City (8:00-9:00) - Visit Hida Takayama for sightseeing (90 minutes) - Visit Shirakawago and walk around for 70 minutes - Return to Nagoya city (estimated arrival time: 16:00-17:00) The estimated fare for highway is 10,000 JPY, for parking is 1,500 JPY, and the lunch fee is 1,000 JPY-2,000 JPY / person. Please have your lunch by yourself at Hida Takayama. You can also choose to visit Hida Furukawa instead of Hida Takayama, please let us know when making the reservation for this tour. The pick-up/drop-off places must be within Nagoya city, and the departure time must be in between 8:00-9:00. Enjoy this eight hours private tour with an English or Chinese translator, and have an unforgettable moments in Gifu! ※Important Notes※ 1. Please make the reservation for this tour five days in advance. 2. The maximum participants of this tour is 5 persons per bus 3. Please make sure to inform us the following items: - Number of participants and their ages - Departure time, pick-up and drop-off places within Nagoya city 4. This tour fee includes sightseeing mini bus, driver, and English or Chinese translator. 5. You have to pay the highway fare, parking fees, admission fees, lunch fees, and other fees that are not included by cash 6. strIntroduction: If you are looking for an exclusive private journey in Kyoto, this private mini bus tour program is the answer! Have a wonderful private trip in Kyoto with your friends or family only, and explore the beauty of Kyoto prefecture with a language assistance provided by our top-notch English or Chinese translator! This journey starts at Motoise Kono Shrine, a shrine located in the Northern end of the Amanohashidate Sandbar, which is also the most important shrine of the Tango Region in Northern Kyoto Prefecture. The shrine is dedicated to various Gods such as Amaetrasu, Sarutahiko, Ebisu, Inari, and the Kasuga. Explore the history and the culture of Motoise Kono Shrine, before heading to Kasamatsu Park. After that, take the cable car to Kasamatsu Park, and enjoy the view of the sandbar is from the high altitude! Also walk through the pine tree rows of Amanohashidate with the staff to explore its great nature! Visit Chionji Temple, located at the Southern entrance of the Amanohashidate Sandbar, before returning to Kyoto city! Chionji temple is famous for giving the visitors wisdom, academic, and personal success. The itinerary for the tour is as follows: - Departs from Kyoto city (8:00-10:00) - Visit Motoise Kono Shrine and walk around for 30 minutes - Visit Kasamatsu Park for sightseeing and to get on the cable car (60 minutes, cable car fare: 330 JPY / person) - Visit Amanohashidate to explore the pine trees row (90 minutes) - Visit Chionji Temple and walk around for 30 minutes - Return to Kyoto city (estimated arrival time: 16:00-18:00)\ The estimated fare for highway is 6,500 JPY, for parking is 1,000 JPY, and the lunch fee is 1,000 JPY-3,000 JPY / person. Please have your lunch by yourself at Kasamatsu Park or Chionji Temple. The pick-up/drop-off places must be within Kyoto city, and the departure time must be in between 8:00-10:00. Enjoy this seven hours private tour with an English or Chinese translator, and have an unforgettable moments in Kyoto! ※Important Notes※ 1. strIntroduction: Visit Fukui and have a wonderful dining experience consisting delicious seafood and Japanese snow crabs! This journey departs from Nagoya Station and will take you to Konbu Museum where you can find many types of seaweed kelp products before heading to Wakasa for lunch! Enjoy a luxurious dining at Wakasa, consisting two different courses that you can choose for lunch, with the following contents: Greedy Course (using 3 snow crabs) - Grilled crab - Crab sashimi - Steamed egg custard with crab meat - Crab hot-pot - Crab delicacies - Crab salad - Seasoned rice with crab meat Deluxe Course (using 1 big snow crab and other crabs) - One big snow crab - Grilled crab - Crab Sashimi - Steamed egg custard with crab meat - Crab hot-pot - Crab delicacies - Crab salad - Seasoned rice with crab meat Please let us know which lunch courses you would like to have when making a reservation for this program. If you are making a group reservation, you can choose different courses for each member. We will arrange the deluxe course as your lunch if you don't mention your choice when making the reservation. After lunch, visit Tsuruga Port, one of the most important ports in Japan, and enjoy the breathtaking view of Sea of Japan! After that, visit Nihonkai Sakanamachi and kamaboko shop for shopping many fresh seafood products and fishcakes before returning to Nagoya! The itinerary for this tour is as follows: - Depart from Nagoya Station at 8:20 - Visit Konbu Museum for shopping - Visit Wakasa for lunch (60 minutes) - Visit Tsuruga Port for sightseeing - Visit Nihonkai Sakanamachi for shopping - Visit Kamaboko Shop (fishcake) for shopping - Return to Nagoya Station at 17:00 Make a reservation with our service and have a wonderful dining experience in Fukui! strIntroduction: Experience an authentic Japanese winter holiday by visiting the Tohoku region and enjoy its beautiful winter panorama and its delicious winter cuisines! This journey starts at Onogawa Onsen, where you can see the beautiful Snow Hut Village in Yamagata. Onogawa Onsen is famous for its rich nature and great panorama of the Snow Hut Village, and the water of the hot springs is believed to enhance the beauty of the users. Please note that if the snow falls you will be visiting Yonezawa instead of visiting the Onogawa Onsen. After that, you will take the train from Imaizumi Station to enjoy the beautiful view of the snow cape from the windows before having a ride on a ropeway. After that, you will take a ropeway from Zao to watch the beautiful glowing Zao Light Up for 90 minutes, before heading to Togatta Onsen. You will stay at Miyagi Zao Royal Hotel, and rejuvenate yourself by soaking into an open air bath! On the second day, you will visit Miyagi Zao, where you will drive through the Zao Forests with snow cars equipped with heater. Explore the great nature of Zao Forest, which is only reachable exclusively by the mountain climbers, and enjoy having your lunch surrounded by the greens. Also visit the Zao Kokeshi Kan Museum to see the wooden dolls, and shop at a cheese shop in Zao before returning to Tokyo! The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 - Depart from Tokyo by Yamabiko Shinkansen (9:24-10:12) - Arrive in Fukushima - Visit Onogawa Onsen for Snow Hut Village, or Yonezawa for sightseeing when snow falls (20 minutes) - Take the train from Imaizumi station to enjoy the scenic view of snow scape from the window (15 minutes) - Arrive in Miyauchi and visit Zao to take the ropeway and watch the Juhyo Light Up (90 minutes) - Visit Togatta Onsen and spend the night at Miyagi Zao Royal Hotel Day 2 - Visit Miyagi Zao and drive through the Zao Forests with snow cars equipped with heater (3 hours, including lunch time) - Visit Miyagi Zao Kokeshi Kan Museum to see the wooden dolls (30 minutes) - Visit a cheese shop at Zao (20 minutes) - Return to Tokyo withy Yamabiko Shinkansen from Koriyama - Arrive in Tokyo (18:30-18:48) Make a reservation for this program with our service and enjoy a splendid winter holiday experience this year!
strTitle: See The Glowing Snow Scape & Explore Zao Forest in Miyagi!

strIntroduction: Have a wonderful winter journey in Gifu and Toyama and visit Gokayama, Shirakawago and Hida Takayama area to enjoy its scenic view and delicious local foods! This journey starts at Gokayama, where you will visit the Gasshozukuri Farm Houses Village, which is registered as UNESCO World Heritage Site. Explore Gokayama and enjoy the scenic view of snow-covered thatched roofs farm houses! Have a wonderful Hokuriku buffet-style dinner and fill your tummy with snow crab, amaebi shrimp, and other Toyama's delicacies for an hour before heading to the hotel. Relax and have a good rest at APA Hotel Toyama or at APA Hotel Toyama Ekimae, one of the best chain hotels in Japan. On the second day, you will visit Shirakawago and Suganuma Gasshozukuri Village, one of Japan's most important historic sites and preservation districts, which is also registered as UNESCO World Heritage Site. Enjoy the great view of 9 thatched roof farm houses and explore the local history and local culture by strolling around the area! After that, you will visit Hida Takayama to visit the old town Little Kyoto, to feel the atmosphere and to explore the culture of Edo period. Also have a wonderful Hida Beef Sukiyaki all-you-can-eat lunch! ※Please let us know if you cannot eat beef when making this reservation, so we can prepare a seafood lunch set for you. After that, don't forget to stop by the Hirayu for shopping before returning to Shinjuku! The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 - Depart from Shinjuku at 7:50 - Visit Gokayama and Suganuma Gassho-zukuri Village and stroll around for 50 minutes - Visit Toyama and stay at APA Hotel Toyama or at APA Hotel Toyama Ekimae Day 2 - Visit Shirakawago and Suganuma Gassho and walk around for 60 minutes. - Visit Hida Takayama to walk around and to enjoy the scenery of the old town Little Kyoto for 60 minutes - Have an all-you-can-eat Hida Beef lunch for 50 minutes - Visit Hirayu and shop for 30 minutes - Arrive in Shinjuku (19:30-20:00) This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: This journey starts at Ena, a small town in Gifu where the beautiful Ena Valley is located. Ena Gorge is a man-made lake, which is formed from the construction of a dam down by the river. In the spring, Ena Gorge is filled with the blooming cherry blossoms, and in the fall, Ena Gorge is filled with the red autumn leaves, which is very beautiful. You can cruise along the valley if you want to by paying the extra charge for 1,150 JPY on site. You will have lunch by yourself at Ena, or you can choose one of the optional menu for the lunch when reserving this tour program. The menu for the lunch is as follows: - Ena chicken, mushroom nabe hotpot, and rice with mountain vegetables lunch box - Hida beef sukiyaki lunch box After lunch, you will visit Butai Toge Pass, a recreational area close to Gero area for shopping. After spending some time at Butai Toge Pass, this journey will take you to Gero Onsen Suimeikan, a five stars hotel in Gero. Enjoy relaxing yourself in the Cypress aroma bath and have a delicious kaiseki dinner at the dining room while enjoying the chef preparing your meal in an open kitchen. On the second day, you will visit Hida Takayama to walk around and to explore its great nature. Please have your own lunch at Hida Takayama before heading to Shirakawago. After lunch, you will visit Shirakawago, a village registered as UNESCO World Heritage Site, which is famous for its thatched roofs houses. Stroll around and explore the local culture of Shirakawago before heading back to Kansai! The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 - Depart from Kyoto (7:50) or Umeda (8:00) - Visit Ena and have your lunch there (50 minutes) - Visit Ena Gorge and stroll around (40 minutes) - Visit Butai Toge Pass and shop around (25 minutes) - Visit Gero Onsen Suimeikan and spend the night there Day 2 - Visit Hida Takayama and walk around (60 minutes) - Visit Takayama and have your lunch there (50 minutes) - Visit Shirakawago and walk around (60 minutes) - Arrive at Namba and Umeda (19:00-20:30) This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: Visit Yokohama to have a wonderful Chinese dining experience at a famous Chinese restaurant in Yokohama Chinatown and to enjoy the astonishing night factory view at Keihin Canal while cruising! This journey starts at Yokohama Chinatown, where you will enjoy an all-you-can-eat Chinese dinner (135 choices of dishes) for 2 hours at Chuugoku-hanten, a famous Chinese restaurant specializing in shark's fin dishes! After dinner, you will walk yourself to Osanbashi Wharf Building to watch the night factory view of Keihin Canal for 90 minutes. strIntroduction: If you are looking for an exclusive private tour to Nikko, which participants are your friends or family only, this private bus tour program is the answer! This tour will pick you up anywhere within 23 wards of Tokyo with a mini bus and an English or Chinese translator that will take you to Nikko area for sightseeing! The journey starts at Toshogu Shrines, a Shinto shrine located in Nikko, which is the main attraction of Nikko, registered as the UNESCO World Heritage. The shrine is dedicated to the spirit of Ieyasu, the founder of Tokugawa Shogunate, a military dynasty that ruled Japan from 1603 to 1867. Explore the history and the culture of Tokugawa Shogunate, as you will have 2 hours for walking around and to have your lunch there before heading to Chuzenji. Lake Chuzenji is one of the most beautiful lakes in Japan, located at the foot of Mt. Nantai, a sacred volcano in Nikko. You will also visit the Kegon Falls, which is the most famous waterfall in Nikko National Park. The itinerary for the tour is as follows: - Departs from the designated pick up place (within 23 wards) (8:00-9:00) - Visit Nikko Toshogu Shrines for two hours to have lunch and to stroll around - Visit Lake Chuzenji and walk around - Walk from Lake Chuzenji to Kegon Falls for 60 minutes - Return to Tokyo (within 23 wards) The estimated fare for highway is 8,760 JPY, for parking is 1,500 JPY - 2,000 JPY, and the lunch fee is 1,080 JPY per person. The pick-up/drop-off places and the time can be arranged upon request, and the spacious mini bus can accommodate your large baggage as well. Enjoy this ten hours private tour with an English or Chinese translator, and have an unforgettable moments in Nikko! ※Important Notes※ 1. strIntroduction: This wonderful winter journey will take you to Gifu and Nagano to enjoy the beautiful view of Shirakawago's winter panorama, delicious local cuisine of Hida Takayama, and to explore the local culture of Shirakawago and Takayama area! The journey starts in Hirayu, a hot springs area in Takayama, where you will stop by for shopping. After visiting Hirayu, you will stop by Shirakawago, a village located at the foot of Mt. Hakusan. The village is famous for its 114 thatched roof houses standing altogether, which makes this site is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You will have the chance to stroll around and explore the local culture of Shirakawago for an hour. Have lunch by yourself and try the delicious local food of Shirakawago as well! An optional lunch “Toge No Kamameshi” is available for 1,000 JPY upon request, please let us know when making a reservation for this tour. “Toge No Kamameshi” is a mixed steamed rice consisting bamboo shoot, chestnuts, burdock, quail egg, chicken meat, shiitake mushroom, green peas, apricot, and red pickled ginger, but sometimes the ingredients slightly change depending on the seasons. After that, you will visit Hida Folk Village to see beautiful view of the glowing snow-covered thatched roofs houses for 30 minutes before heading to Takayama for dinner. Enjoy an all-you-can-eat dining experience of Takayama’s most famous delicacies, “Hida Beef” for your dinner before heading to the hotel. Just in case if you cannot eat beef, please let us know when booking so we can prepare an alternative dinner for you. Also enjoy staying at Hotel Associa Takayama Resorts, a 5-star hotel that has 10 different kinds of hot springs and a large open air bath facing the Alps! On the second day, you will visit the Little Kyoto for sightseeing and to visit the morning market. Later on you will have a ride on the snow-viewing local train to see the great winter panorama of Takayama, and then you will visit Butai Pass to have lunch there. The journey will take you to Kashimo Meijiza, where you will have a theater tour for half an hour, and then you will go to Megome Juku to stroll around the beautiful old town before returning to Shinjuku. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 - Meet at Shinjuku (8:10) - Visit Hirayu and shop around for 25 minutes - Visit Shirakawago and stroll around for 60 minutes - Visit Hida Folk Village to see the illumination for 30 minutes - Visit Takayama and have an all-you-can-eat Hida beef for dinner - Visit Hida Takayama Onsen and spend the night at Hotel Associa Takayama Resorts. Day 2 - Visit Hidatakayama and stroll around the Little Kyoto for 50 minutes - Visit Takayama Station and take the snow-viewing local train for 16 minutes - Arrive at Kuguno Station and take a bus ride to Butai Pass and have lunch there for 50 minutes - Visit Kashimo Meijiza and have a theater tour for 30 minutes - Visit Magome-juku and stroll around for 50 minutes - Visit Iida for shopping - Arrive in Shinjuku (estimated arrival time: 19:30-20:00) This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: Visit Shirakawago and have a wonderful winter journey by staying at Hotel Associa Takayama Resort, our highest grade hotel! Enjoy the great winter panorama of Shirakawago and Hida Takayama, and enjoy the winter illumination of Hida Folk Village! Enjoy an all-you-can-eat Hida beef sukikiyaki and try the most delicious rice in Japan, “Gin No Mikazuki”! The journey starts at Mino, which is famous for its local gourmet. You can buy your lunch at Mino by yourself, or you can have lunch at the designated restaurant by purchasing the lunch option menu when making a reservation for this program. You can either choose the steamed maitake mushroom dishes or grilled Miso pork on Hoba leaf for your lunch. If you are interested in having one of these dishes for your lunch, don’t forget to purchase it when booking! After visiting Mino for lunch, this journey will take you to Shirakawago, a village located at the foot of Mt. Hakusan, which is registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. You can find 114 thatched roof houses stand altogether, which roofs are covered by the snow in the winter. Stroll around Shirakawago and explore the local culture for 80 minutes! After visiting Shirakawago, you will visit the Hida Folk Village Winter Illumination, where you can see the beautiful illuminated snow-covered thatched roof houses for 45 minutes! Enjoy an all-you-can-eat Hida beef sukiyaki dinner for an hour, and enjoy the juicy Hida beef that melts right away as it gets into your mouth! After the dinner, you will go to Hotel Associa Takayama, our highest grade hotel to spend the remaining night! Also enjoy rejuvenating yourself in its huge open air bath! On the next day, this journey starts at Butai Toge, where you can try the most delicious rice in Japan “Gin No Mikazuki”, prepared with the traditional rice cooker by the Chef. “Gin No Mikazuki” has won “Japan’s Most Delicious Rice Contest” for three times, which is considered as a very prestigious achievement in Japan. Before returning to Kansai, you will stop by the Kashimo Meijiza, one of the most important traditional theaters in Japan, and visit the Tsumago-juku, a designated national preservation area district of important traditional structure. The itinerary for this tour is as follows: Day 1 - Meet at Kyoto (8:50), Tennoji (8:50), or Umeda (9:00) - Visit Mino to have lunch by yourself for 50 minutes - Visit Shirakawago and stroll around for 80 minutes - Visit Hida Folk Village and watch the illumination for 45 minutes - Visit Takayama to have dinner for 60 minutes - Visit Hida Takayama Onsen and spend the night at Hotel Associa Takayama Resort Day 2 - Depart from Hida Takayama Onsen - Visit Butai Toge and have lunch for 50 minutes - Visit Kashimo Meijiza for 30 minutes - Visit Tsumago-juku and stroll around for 40 minutes - Return to Namba or Kyoto (estimated arrival time 19:00-21:00) Enjoy a winter journey to Gifu and Nagano by making a reservation for this wonderful program! Minimum 2 participants per booking are necessary. Solo travelers cannot book this tour. This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: Have an early winter journey by visiting Yamanashi to explore the Lake Yamanaka area and enjoy the great view of the snow-capped Mt. Fuji! This journey starts at Chateau Katsunuma, where you can shop Yamanashi’s original Japanese wines and souvenirs. Then you will have your lunch at Sato no Eki Ichinomiya, where you can enjoy the juicy Koshu beef, grilled warm vegetables, 3 kinds of chicken dishes, grilled fish, and other seasonal dishes served with fluffy rice and miso soup! ※If you cannot eat meat, or have any particular allergies, please let us know when booking this program so we can arrange an alternative for your lunch. After lunch, you will visit Lake Yamanaka to have a ride on the KABA bus, an amphibious bus that lets you drive into the forest of Lake Yamanaka and dive into Lake Yamanaka. Explore the great nature of Lake Yamanaka and have a wonderful amphibious bus ride experience as well! ※KABA bus might be cancelled due to severe weather conditions. In this case, we will refund the fare for KABA bus and substitute this activity with a visit to different tourist spot. Infants (0-3 years old) are required to pay the insurance when boarding for 400 JPY (tax included). Please pay it directly to the tour guide by cash. After riding on the KABA bus, you will visit the Saiko Juhyo Festival, which is also famous as “Lake Saiko Ice Festival”. At this festival, you can enjoy the breathtaking view of illuminated ice objects and frost-covered gigantic trees, the hidden gems of Japan. ※Please wear warm clothes as it will be very cold after the sunset The itinerary for this tour is as follows: - Meet at Washington Hotel Shinjuku at 10:30 - Take the bus to Chateau Katsunuma and shop around for 20 minutes - Visit Sato no Eki Ichinomiya and have lunch for 40 minutes - Visit Lake Yamanaka and have a ride on KABA bus for 30 minutes (land:10 minutes and lake:20 minutes) - Visit Saiko Juhyo Festival and watch the Juhyo illumination for 70 minutes - Return to Shinjuku (estimated arrival time is 19:30-20:00) Have a wonderful early winter journey by visiting Lake Yamanaka and spend an unforgettable moment with your friends, family, or someone special! This tour is provided by YOKOSO Japan Tour Check the Tour Conditions link below. http://voyag.in/2diT9k2

strIntroduction: It’s fun to make your own hand roll sushi and be creative while cooking! Hand roll sushi is a popular menu at every home party in Japan. It is made of a rolled cone of seaweed paper, wrapped around rice and fillings. The best part is that this is a meal that everyone joins in making without training! At the table, each person makes their own hand roll sushi based on their preference. Now it's your turn to enjoy this traditional and fun food! If you don't eat raw fish, I can prepare cooked fillings as well!
strTitle: Enjoy a Private Hand Roll Sushi Cooking Class in Tokyo

strIntroduction: All meals, lodging and transportation is included in the tour price to/from Kyoto Station. Luggage forwarding service also provided (so you only need to hike with a daypack, and you won't need to carry your suitcase while we're hiking or sightseeing). Looking to escape the crowds of Kyoto or Tokyo and have limited time? We've created the Kumano Pilgrimage Tour just for you! Our shortest tour takes you through the oldest and most historically significant of the four Kumano Kodo pilgrimage routes - the Nakahechi. We begin at Kobiro-toge, a dark, densely forested section of the trail that is famous in old pilgrim tales for the beasts and goblins that were said to live there. From here we begin the climb into the Kumano mountains via the Nakahechi trail. As we trek we follow in the footsteps of mountain ascetics and emperors from centuries past on their way to the grand shrine of Kumano Hongu Taisha, passing through their places of worship and long-abandoned tea houses. This hearkens to a time when so many Japanese completed the pilgrimage that it was commonly referred to as the "Kumano ant processions." It will take us two days of trekking 6 hours each day to get to Hongu Shrine, the shrine that all four pilgrimage routes lead to. For our first night we'll be staying in Yunomine Onsen, one of Japan's oldest hot spring towns (at least 1,800 years old!). Our accommodation is a comfortable family-run ryokan inn, complete with an open-air stone bath you can enjoy privately. The food is delicious Japanese onsen cuisine that you can enjoy with sake or a cold beer after our day of trekking. Within the town of Yunomine Onsen you can take a soak in the World Heritage hot spring called Tsuboyu (pictured above), located in a cabin on a river where the natural mouth of the hot spring is. This first-come-first-serve onsen can be used privately by 1-2 people for 30 minutes. On Day 2 we'll leave our accommodation and get back on the Kumano Kodo trail to hike to Kumano Hongu Taisha shrine. It will take us about 5 hours to get there including a stop for lunch. After touring the shrine we'll head downhill to nearby Oyunohara. Hongu was originally located at Oyunohara before massive flooding in 1889 led to the shrine's relocation at the current site. Oyunohara is now the site of the world's largest torii gate, the Otorii, a massive steel structure which stands at nearly 34 meters high. From Oyunohara we'll trek on a more direct trail back to Yunomine Onsen, grab our bags and head to Kawayu Onsen, another hot spring village famous for its free, public, open-air onsen in the river that flows past the village. We'll stay in a ryokan inn again and you'll have the option of eating Yakuzen ryori, or traditional health food, for dinner. We wake up the morning of our third and final day and hop on a riverboat on the Kumanogawa river towards Hayatama Taisha shrine, another World Heritage site that Kumano Kodo pilgrims would visit as part of their journey. The scenic 1.5 hour traditional longboat ride includes stories from our Japanese boat guide on the history of the river and the folk tales that come with it. After getting off the boat and touring Hayatama Taisha shrine, we'll take a short walk to one of the oldest sites in Shino: Gotobiki-iwa. Gotobiki-iwa refers to a massive boulder at the top of a hill near Hayatama shrine where the gods first descended onto earth. After visiting Gotobiki-iwa we'll make our way to Shingu Station and arrive back at Kyoto Station by 8:20 pm via train where our tour officially ends.
strTitle: Embark on the Kumano Kodo Pilgrimage (2-nights, 3-days)

strIntroduction: Those looking to complete the full Kumano Kodo pilgrimage to the three grand shrines of the Kumano sect of Shinto can complete the journey on my Kumano World Heritage Tour. This tour takes you to nine UNESCO World Heritage sites: the original pilgrimage route known as the Nakahechi, the 1,800 year old Tsuboyu hot spring, the Kumanogawa river used by pilgrims to travel south from Hongu Taisha, Gotobiki-iwa, Seigantoji temple, Nachi Falls, and all three grand shrines of the Kumano sect known as Hongu Taisha, Nachi Taisha and Hayatama Taisha. The tour begins at 6:30am on Day 1 in Kyoto Station where we'll have a quick briefing before hopping on the coastal Kuroshio Express down the Kii Peninsula. We'll make our way to Hosshinmon-oji, a subsidiary shrine called "the gate to spiritual awakening." Here we'll start our hike along the Akagi-goe route, a centuries-old ridge trail leading to Yunomine Onsen. We'll spend our first two nights in the nationally famous hot spring towns of Yunomine Onsen and Kawayu Onsen. We choose the comfortable ryokan inns we stay at because they offer participants an authentically Japanese experience, complete with local delicacies for dinner and fantastic in-house hot springs. Outside of the ryokan, the town of Kawayu Onsen has a free, public, mixed gender (swimsuits required) hot spring that is built into the banks of the river that flows through town. In Yunomine Onsen, you'll be able to enjoy the World Heritage hot spring of Tsuboyu. On our second day we'll hike from our lodging to Kumano Hongu Taisha, the grand shrine that all four Kumano pilgrimage routes lead to. After touring the grounds of the shrine and visiting it's original location where the world's largest torii gate, Otorii, now stands, we'll head to a lookout point of the shrine grounds and enjoy a bento lunch. In the afternoon we'll return to our lodging where you can enjoy a soak in the hot spring after a full day of hiking. On Day 3 we'll take a riverboat along the World Heritage Kumanogawa river as we make our way down to the southern tip of the Kii peninsula. Along the way, our riverboat guide will share folktales and point out landmarks. We'll get off the boat in the town of Shingu and head to Hayatama Taisha, the second of the Kumano Grand Shrines that we'll visit on this trip. After a tour of the shrine grounds we'll head to Gotobiki-iwa, a massive boulder that is now a Shinto object of worship but has been worshiped by ancient indigenous religions for more than two thousand years. On our third and final night we'll stay at a ryokan in the coastal town of Kii-Katsuura. On the menu is local, freshly caught tuna sashimi. On Day 4 of the Kumano World Heritage Tour we'll trek to Nachi Taisha, completing our pilgrimage to the Three Grand Shrines of Kumano. Beautiful Nachi Falls (pictured above) is the backdrop for this shrine located in the mountains of Kumano. Right next to the grand shrine is Seigantoji, a World Heritage Buddhist temple. The large, wooden temple was built over 300 years ago and no screws or nails were used in its construction. Finally, we'll head to the three-story Sanjudo pagoda and Nachi Falls before heading to the rail station. We'll take the coastal Kuroshio Express train back to Kyoto Station by 8:20 pm (and if your next destination is Osaka, no worries, its on the way).
strTitle: Join the Kumano World Heritage Tour (3-nights, 4-days)

strIntroduction: In this tour, our guide from Tokyo Flour Mania will guide you through bakeries and traditional spots in the Roppongi/Azabu area, an international and upmarket district where many embassies and foreign companies are located. We will visit a bakery (ABUMI) which is very close to Tokyo Tower at first and move to Azabu Juban and Roppongi. Then, we will split up at Roppongi Hills so that you can enjoy the shopping, lunch, etc. after the tour. Below is the list of bakeries we will visit. ・ ABUMI BAKERY This bakery was started in 2015 by a husband and wife. Their bread is made from Japanese domestic flour and Hoshino/raisin homemade yeast. We can enjoy breads that have a unique combination such as “miso bagel”. The owner says, “I would like you to enjoy our breads that you cannot find at any other place.” ・ Comète The shop name comes from a proverb in France “Et si on tirait plans sur la comète?” which means drawing a plan on comete (setting an impossible goal). The owner chef opened his own shop earlier this year in July 2016 after training at “Du Pain et Des Idées,” a famous bakery in Paris. You can enjoy “escargot” which is one of the icon breads at “Du Pain et Des Idées” as well. The other recommendation is “comete,” an original bread which shares the same name as the shop. Except for baguettes, all breads are made with Japanese flour as a means to contribute to domestic agriculture. ・ L’Atelier du Pain This bakery is managed by a company in the wine business. They are very particular about each process to make a bread: milling flour in their kitchen, making the dough with a high portion of liquid (wet dough), fermenting the dough in a low temperature, using homemade yeast, and baking the breads in a stone oven. Therefore you can enjoy the fresh flavor of flour and a kind chewy texture called mucchiri in Japanese. Breads that use shiratamako (rice flour for dumpling) are highly recommended. “Roppongi anpan” (red bean paste-filled bun) is the most popular item. ** We will be sharing one popular bread from each bakery. We will be tasting three kinds of bread in total. Please feel free to purchase any other breads on your own. ** We are planning on walking, but there is the option to take the bus. If the bus option is preferred, please note that bus transportation is not included in the cost of the tour. We might be able to accept special requests, but our regular time slots for the tour are: 9:30-11:30 on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday Please wear comfortable clothes and shoes for walking.
strTitle: Discover hidden bakeries on a Bakery Tour in Roppongi-Azabu!

strIntroduction: Experience Japanese dance with Kimono! Do you know what Japanese dance is? Japanese dances have a long history. For example, they come from Japanese folklore, history, festivals, etc. Some of you know Kabuki theater. Kabuki is really like Japanese dance but, Kabuki is not allowed to be played by girls. On the other hand, Japanese dance is open for everybody. You can enjoy not only dancing with Kimono, but also feeling Japanese Omotenashi hospitality! It takes about 2 and half to 3 hours. We can adjust the time. We'll pick you up at Morioka Station in Iwate. You can come here from Tokyo by Shinkansen. First, we'll teach you how to put on a Kimono. We have Kimono for different sizes: children, men, women, so everybody can join. After putting on the Kimono, you can learn Japanese dance! We have many songs and will teach you seasonal dances. For example, you can learn the cherry blossom's song and dance in spring. After you finish the lesson, we can take photos of you and take a break with green tea. After you return the Kimono, we'll take you to your hotel (in Morioka) or Morioka Station.
strTitle: Enjoy traditional Japanese dance experience in Morioka

strIntroduction: This is a professional photographer service! Our photographer will accompany you during your tour in Tokyo. This is not a guided tour, simply a photo service. Of course, you can ask the photographer for recommendations. Usually when we travel we take photos of each other or take selfies. But if a pro photographer takes photo and accompanies you on the trip, you can get better photos that you can't take of each other. We think good photos is the best memory from any trip. Please let us know where you will go and feel free to ask about details. ーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーーー Photographer: One person for one group Location: Tokyo Time : 60 minutes
strTitle: Book a photographer service during your travel in Tokyo

strIntroduction: First of all, we'll meet up at your hotel or at Tsutsujigaoka Station of Keio line. Jindaiji Temple is an old temple just like Sensoji Temple in Asakusa. We'll go to Jindaiji Temple by bus that we'll take in front of the station. It will take about 15 minute by bus. We'll take a walk through a grove and around Jindaiji Temple which is protected by pure spring water. There are many tea houses and the gift shops around Jindaiji Temple, and you can feel the busy atmosphere around. See the old Jindaiji Temple established more than 1200 years ago. You'll feel the atmosphere of the temple where Japanese traditions of the old days are preserved. We'll have soba noodles at a traiditional soba shop in the neighborhood. The nearby shops are also in an old Japanese style. Let's enjoy this tour together!
strTitle: Take a private tour to the local Jindaiji Temple in Tokyo

strIntroduction: If you want to plan a cherry blossom viewing picnic but are concerned with troublesome set up, carrying heavy things or cleaning up, we have some good news for you. We have prepared the perfect picnic plan for foreign visitors in Hirosaki Park. It is a limited special plan for only 10 customers a day! Details: Sunday, April 23, 2017 - Wednesday, May 3, 2017 Time: 12:00 - 13:30 (90 minutes) Schedule: - Meet at the East Entrance of the park on the reserved day. A ninja will meet you personally! - Begin the cherry viewing picnic after the set-up is complete. About the lunch: The bento boxed lunch serviced exclusively at the picnic uses local ingredients and is presented in a Tsugaru lacquer lunch box. The featured drink at the cherry blossom viewing picnic is local sake selected by a specialist, and served in Tsugaru vidro sake glass. Aomori apple cider (sparkling alcoholic cider) is also available. - Enjoy the cherry viewing while listening to Neputa music (90 minutes). - After 90 minutes, the staff will come and clean up the site. Reservations are accepted until April 9.
strTitle: Enjoy Sakura Viewing Picnic with Music in Hirosaki, Aomori

strIntroduction: This is a fun and relaxed cooking class in Tokyo! Choose between a morning class (you will make Kaiseki with Wagyu beef) or an afternoon class (Sushi): Morning Class: 9:30 am-12:30 pm Kaiseki, it is a Japanese traditional multi course served at Japanese fancy restaurants or Japanese style inns. Besides you will cook and taste Wagyu beef which is popular for its smooth texture and rich flavor. This class covers 7-8 dishes from appetizer to desert, not only the method but also the presentation. Afternoon Class: 1:30 pm-4:30 pm Sushi, needless to say, it is the most famous Japanese food in and out of Japan! This class focuses on how to make Sushi at home, so you can try Sushi making for your family and friends after you return home. During the class, you will make some types of typical Sushi such as Nigiri, Inari, Gunkan and Sushi rolls, then enjoy them with fresh wasabi and miso soup.
strTitle: Learn How to Cook Traditional Dishes at Home!

strIntroduction: Mountains, rivers, and the sea, can all be reached within one hour from the Shonai Plains in Yamagata. Using only the finest ingredients, enjoy a lunch experience at the nationally-renowned Al che-cciano Restaurant. The spotlight focused on the area as it became the setting for the NHK television drama series "Oshin" and now people come from across the country to stay at the nationally-famous Ginzan Onsen, experience the three-star Michelin rated Mt. Haguroyama, and take in the wonders of jellyfish at the "Kurage Dream-kan" Kamo Aquarium. The Shonai region of Yamagata Pref. is a treasure trove of ingredients, so much that Shonai Airport is called the "City of Food". Resevations are hard to get at the ever-popular Al che-cciano restaurant - one of the top 100 restaurants chosen by chefs the world over. After a gourmet lunch here, take in the sights and stay in Ginzan Onsen, which offers its authentic feeling of Taisho Romanticism. You can feel totally relaxed in the outside bathing pools surrounded in a glorious mountain setting with the gentle river murmur, birds chirping, and the mild rustle of the tree leaves. Also on offer is the Michelin three-star rated Mt. Haguroyama, the world-leading jellyfish aquarium ""Kurage Dream-kan"" Kamo Aquarium, or taking in the relaxed atmosphere with an easy cruise down the Mogami River, whose scenery beautifully changes with the four seasons. Itinerary: Day One: Transfer by dedicated transport to the Al che-cciano restaurant after arriving at either Shonai Airport at 11:55 or Tsuruoka Station at 12:45. This is followed by three-star Michelin rated Mt. Haguroyama sightseeing. Move to the Ginzan Onsen and your accomodation at the "Ginzanso" after taking in the National Treasure Five-Story Pagoda, and a visit to Mt. Haguroyama. Day Two: 9:30, depart Ginzanso, 10:50 Mogami River cruising. Arrival at 11:50, and then head along the main road to the port town Sakata. Enjoy choosing your favorite Sakata Ramen (noodles) in the land that is known as Japan's Ramen mecca, as it is number one for Ramen consumption. Later, enjoy the Sankyo soko and the Maiko dance at the Somaro from 14:00. Then take in Japan's leading "Kurage Dream-kan", before finishing the tour at Shonai Airport or Tsuruoka station at 17:00.
strTitle: 2-day Tour in Yamagata: Ginzan Onsen, cruising and gourmet

strIntroduction: Enjoy your day to Nikko Toshogu, the most gorgeous Shrine in Japan bilt to dedicate Tokugawa Ieyasu's death, the first shogun of Edo era. Travel back in time to Edo era at the Edo wonderland theme park, dress up in samurai, nijnja, princess, geisha, etc., become an "Edokko" and get to know the life of Edo. If you prefer to relax we can go to onsen (Japanese hot spring) as we Japanese always prefer to bathe after a journey. If you are hesitant bathing with other people tell me so, I will arrange to have more sight seeing. A convenient mini-van chartered just for your and your group. A Japanese, English and French-speaking multilingual guide will be on board to assist you along the way. A Chinese-speaking guide is also available upon request. 8:30 Meet and Pick-Up at Your Requested Location in Tokyo 11:00 Nikko Toshogu shrine Visit the world heritage site, Toshogu Shrine, Rinnouji Temple, and Futarasan Shrine. Lake Chuzenji and Kegon Fall. Admission fee for Toshogu: 1300 JPY over 16 years old, 450 JPY under 15 years old 13:00 Lunch Local food for luch, ask your guide if you have any recommendations. (Lunch fee is not included in the tour fee) 14:30 Nikko Edo Wonderland Become your favorite edo style Japanese and go back in time. Admission fee for Edo Wonderland: 4,700 JPY over 13 years old, 2,400 JPY under 12 years old Or More sightseeing and go to hot spring Walking around the beatuful lake of Chuzenji, see more falls and walk the Senjogahara, the old battlefield from the acient mythology and end the journey in a relxaing hot spring at Yunomoto. 16:30 Time to leave Nikko and head towards Tokyo 19:00 Drop-off at Your Requested Location in Tokyo
strTitle: Private charter tour to Nikko & Edo Wonderland or hot spring

strIntroduction: Transform yourself into a Warring Era samurai with authentic armor used in Hollywood movies and Japanese 'Sengoku' period dramas! At Sengoku Photo Studio Samurai, you can become Nobunaga Oda, Hideyoshi Toyotomi or Ieyasu Tokugawa and other famous historical figures. What's more, photoshoot poses are arranged by the Kill Bill choreographer, Tetsuro Shimaguchi, ensuring an authentic hollywood photoshoot experience! The brand new studio is specially designed for armor scene photography by a professional photographer with full knowledge of samurai armor, for realistic poses and lighting with a variety of weapons like Japanese swords and spears – the result is a movie-poster-worthy composite photograph captured with your favorite background by a professional designer! Available courses include the option to have silver halide prints, A2 or A1 size posters, mugs, coasters, T-shirts... and even a 90 second movie as souvenirs of your photoshoot experience! Please check each listed option to see the inclusions of each course.
strTitle: Samurai Photoshoot with the Kill Bill Choreographer!

strIntroduction: Treat yourself to an unforgettable evening of fine dining and high entertainment with an exclusive dinner at tempura specialist Aoi Marushin – with the option of adding a traditional geisha or satsuma biwa performance to make it an unforgettable night! Located in the heart of Tokyo's old downtown, Asakusa, where there is still a geisha tradition, you can book a private geisha entertainment together with your kaiseki meal. Alternatively, you can choose from a rare recital of the satsuma biwa, by Master Kakushin Tomoyoshi, one of the few masters of this ancient instrument. Be touched by the clear and moving sounds of the biwa. Last but not least, savor this sensory treat together with a fine dining experience prepared by the expert chefs at Aoi Marushin. Taste tempura like it should be – fresh and crisp, not oily, as it is deep fried at high temperatures using vegetable oil. Enjoy the flavors of seasonal ingredients at this kaiseki dinner course. Experience dinner entertainment like the Edo times, and see the authentic performances of authentic geisha! --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Courses] Aoi Kaiseki Dinner (6800 JPY including tax) - Kaiseki meal (including aperitif, appetizer, sashimi, tempura and dessert) Kinryu Kaiseki Course (10800 JPY including tax) - Kaiseki meal made with greater ingredients than Aoi Kaiseki Dinner (including aperitif, appetizer, sashimi, tempura and dessert) [Options] Private Geisha entertainment -You can enjoy a Geisha performance, one of the most traditional Japanese entertainments, as a private show while having the authentic Kaiseki. Private Satsuma Biwa Performance -The sounds of "Satsuma biwa", the old Japanese instrument, will make your Kaiseki experience even more special, as you feel transported back to the Edo period!
strTitle: Private Geisha or Biwa Show at an Asakusa Tempura Restaurant

strIntroduction: Do you know the movie "My Neighbor Totoro"? It is an animated fantasy film directed by Hayao Miyazaki and produced by Studio Ghibli in 1988. Hayao's animations are very popular in the world like other Japanese anime such as Doraemon, Chibi Maruko-chan, Pokemon. This movie is one of the most popular movies in his works. The story features Japanese countryside life. Two young girls who moved to a house in the countryside meet mystical creatures at the nearby forest, and have several magical adventures. In the movie you can see beautiful Japanese landscapes, so most of its viewers might dream to see the same landscape in Japan. But even if you come to Tokyo or Kyoto, famous tourist cities, you can't see such landscapes easily anywhere! This is because most of the forests near big cities are disappearing more and more due to the civilizing development. Sayama Hills, whose village was modeled for the Totoro movie, is facing the same crisis. Therefore, after the movie hit, a National Trust Fund was raised to protect the forests. Those forests were named "Totoro's Forest" and bought to be preserved. So if you go there, although it's a little developed and civilized, you can see almost the same landscapes as in the movie. Forests, farmlands, rice fields, traditional houses, shrines and temples are still there! This tour will give you the experience of a magical adventure like in "My Neighbor Totoro"! Even though you can't find these spots on guide books, it's surely worth visiting! So let's go to meet Totoro!! First, we will go to Kojiya area in Sayama Hills. There you will see a local shrine, rice fields and muddy ponds surrounded by large forest remaining as in the old days. When you get off the local bus, you will be impressed that the landscape changes dramatically from urban to rural. There you can also meet a mascot named Tocoro-chan which was made by the local people with ceder leaves. Then, we will walk on the hill surrounded by the landscape of tea-plants farmland until "Kurosuke's house". "Kurosuke" is the name of the black-soot character seen at the old house in the movie. This house is an old traditional house having a history of over 100 years and it looks as if Kurosuke lived inside. So it is named "Kurosuke's house"! Here you can meet the "big Totoro character" as well! After that, we'll walk again through the rural landscape until the Japanese Restaurant "Nakamura-ya". At this restaurant you can have high-grade Japanese foods for a reasonable price. Since it is not in crowded tourist city, you can have good food with good atmosphere! Then after lunch, we'll go to the Totoro's forest no.1. There are so many variety of trees that you will get to know how old Japanese people lived together with nature. When you breathe in the middle of the forest, you will feel peaceful in your heart. An old shrine next to the forest is also fantastic, somehow Totoro or some spirits seem to show up from behind! And lastly, after walking along the big beautiful lake of Sayama-ko, we will drop by Sayama-Fudoson and Yamaguchi-Kannon. These two temples were built intentionally after Sayama-ko lake was constructed, so they are a little different from rural landscape. But their large luxury buildings are very interesting and worth seeing, so we will visit them at the end of the tour. The time schedule is below: 9:00 Ikebukuro Station | (Train of Seibu Line) 9:48 Kotesashi Station | (Bus) 10:10 Kojiya Bus Stop | 10:15 Hachiman-Jinja shrine | 11:00 Hira-no-oka | 11:15 Kinsen-ji Temple | 11:40 Kurosuke's House | (Seeing) 12:10 | 12:40 Japanese Restaurant Nakamura-ya | (Lunch) 13:40 | 14:00 Totoro's Forest No.1 | 14:20 Horiguchi-Tenman-Jinja Shrine | 15:00 Sayama-ko lake | 15:30 Sayama-Fudoson | 16:10 Yamaguchi-Kannon | 17:00 Seibu-Kyujo Station | (Train of Seibu Line) 18:00 Ikebukuro Station (*We walk about 9 kilometers, about 5.6 miles, in total.) < Key Words >
